problem.markdown:
>>Why is a tube-framed system more efficient at resisting lateral loads than a traditionally framed building?<<
(x) The tube-framed system has a higher moment of inertia ( ) The tube-framed system has a higher cross-sectional area ( ) The tube-framed system has a higher yield stress ( ) I don’t know
[explanation] By placing the columns of a building on the perimeter you use fewer columns, thus a lower cross-sectional area, to achieve the same moment of inertia. More of the mass (in this case columns) is further from the center, thus increasing the moment of inertia. [explanation]
problem.p: Why is a tube-framed system more efficient at resisting lateral loads than a traditionally framed building?
